text: JUDE MAZZO, United States Attorney for the District of  Columbia, 45, trim, dark full hair. Hey, Jude. It's a nam you remember. It sticks in mind. Jude the Obscure. Jude Mazzo adjusts his tailored suit, crosses underground structure. The first thing you notice is the walk. The Ju walk. Something between a stroll and a strut. The balls o his feet carry his weight effortlessly; his heels follow, scrapping the concrete in precise hypnotic rhythm. The wa of confidence. His walk presumes order in the space throu which it moves, creates an allusion of order if none exis It says: this space has purpose because I am passing thro it. This isn't the confidence of unthought arrogance. It's th considered arrogance of a leader. People want order; they crave it like bread or water. Those who create order are  avatars, above judgement or suspicion. Their walk, their  bearing, the echoing sound of their approaching footsteps are manna for the masses. * Mazzo unlocks his metallic navy blue 1987 Beretta, sits in. Stereo blasts "Chantilly Lace," Big Bopper's 1959 roc hit, as he revs engine. Telephone RINGS from speakers. Th Big Bopper answers in ersatz negroid:
(jaunty) "Hel-lo, ba-by, Yeah, this is the Big Bopper speakin' (demonic laugh) O-oh, you sweet thang! Do I what? Will I what? O-oh, ba-by, You kno-ow what I like!"
Jude squeals off. Sometimes it's not enough to be a born  leader. Sometimes you gotta flaunt it.

Grey structures squat behind iron gates and lush magnolia Mazzo's coupe approaches, parks between dark sedans. Jude gets out, tightens his silk tie as he steps toward sidewa The tie's just the right touch, obtrusive yet elegant: a blue gash neck to navel. Mazzo turns at corner, continues down sidewalk. The score picks up where "Chantilly Lace" cuts off. Music surrounds Jude, always pulsing, pushing forward. Screen credits  continue.
Jude steps into shadow of six-story Post-modern condomini complex. Enters.
Steps to elevator, presses button. Hawaiian paintings ado far wall.

Exits elevator, looks both directions. Hallway empty. Jud walks softly to 5C. He pauses outside door; he pats his h in place, straightens suit and tie. Jude removes key from coat pocket, unlocks door slowly,  silently. He tiptoes inside.

Jude enters silently. Chain-latches door. Jude surveys room with familiar eyes. The only light come from drawn yellowed window shades; thin strips of exterio green foliage glow underneath. The decor jumps out at you: an eclectic jungle of plants paisley. A wall cluttered with clippings butts into a ver tapestry. Second Empire chaise strewn with books. Cheap s music enhances Green Mansions effect. One thing is certain: a woman lives here. Intellectual:  definitely. Young: probably. Impulsive: compulsively. Light shines from open bedroom. Sheets rustle within. Maz lowers salsa muzak, enters. Screen credits continue.

KARIN SCHREIBER, 25, wrapped in pink bed sheet, approache Jude seductively. Dirty blond hair, pale complexion. Eith Dutch or German. She could be a model. Karin opens sheet, drapes it shroud-like over Jude's  shoulders. He glimpses her nudity. She smiles:
(teasing) How will you kill me today?
I'll slit your throat.

Jude removes his blue tie, turns on large TV directly fac Karin's bed. He dials cable box to C-Span: hearings live  from Capitol Hill -- on screen, inaudible, some duly elec asshole pontificates. Karin sits on mattress, stretches. Jude removes suit jacket, folds it over chair, rhythmnica weaves sex fantasy scenario:

It's a political scandal. Misused  funds. Pivot this way, toward the  TV. Kinky sex, ruined career, media  rumors, ridicule -- the Senator was  one of the most respected on the  Hill... (Karin swivels) ...yes, just like that. Member of  the Judicial Committee. Considered  above reproach.

Karin lies facing foot of bed. Random mirrors reflect all four walls. Erotic painting of elaborate coitus, executed Soviet Social Realist style, hangs beside rack of nightgo Stained glass lamps, oddly placed, provide pastel light.  This is boudoir, not bedroom. Karin watches Mazzo disrobe. He places dress shoes -- bla polished, Italian -- neatly under chair, tucks Picasso pa socks inside. Folds, stacks shirt and trousers. Karin flu her pillow. Jude removes bikini briefs, tucks them from sight, slips bed. Karin welcomes him with a smile.

TIMECUT: salsa music BLARES from stereo. Jude and Karin f energetically atop wide oceanic bed. Panting, they change positions, restart. TV casts cathode glow across bed. Karin, astride Jude, silhouetted in C-Span. She grips his buttocks, guides penal thrusts. Her breath quickens. His  panting breaths echo. She digs her fingers into Mazzo's  thighs. Jude's hands rise along her torso. Karin shivers at onset orgasm. She elongates her climax with slow crescendoing  SCREAM, each octave a new plateau of pleasure. Karin's vo fades as she slumps forward, GASPING. Her chest flattens  upon his. She wheezes, then stops. Mazzo pulls himself up beside her -- only then do we noti the blood across his chest and face. Karin is dead. Her t has been slit. Jude eases Karin's body to sheets as he sw his legs to floor. He stands pulling sheet around waist.  Karin watches blank-eyed in pool of blood. Jude waddles from bedroom.
Jude showers. Blood washes down drain.

Mazzo, wrapped in sheet, returns to Karin's bed. He rumag through bloodied bed covers until he finds safety razor b the murder weapon. He hardly notices Karin. Jude wipes ra blade on bed cover, walks away.
Jude takes a glass from cupboard, opens refrigerator door He removes, uncaps bottle of dry vermouth. He fingers the glass as he fills it. Jude lifts vermouth to his lips,  swallows, shivers.

Mazzo enters with bottle and glass, walks to windows. He  raises a center shade, looks outside: traffic passes in  sunlight. He steps to bookshelf, turns off stereo. The sa stops. Weary, Jude lowers himself onto Karin's sofa. He lies sti wrapped in sheet, cradling vermouth bottle and glass, sta at ceiling. Jude's eyes close. He slips lightly to sleep.

TIMECUT: 30 minutes later. Jude is awake and dressed, his spirits replenished. Music score sets him in motion. Mazzo puts on Sahara-brown suit coat as he crosses to bur Blue silk tie hangs loose around his neck. He pulls white handkerchief from pocket, wraps it around  right hand. He opens bureau drawer with covered hand, lea no fingerprints. Inside, Karin's cash and jewelry lie ami personal possessions. Mazzo lifts inlaid box, sets it down. He flips through fo tens and twenties, puts money back, then examines antique jade and silver necklace. Jude pauses to review his strat He carefully wraps handkerchief around necklace, places  necklace in coat pocket. Jude turns to bed where Karin lies twisted in the covers still but still beautiful. He pulls tie from neck, turns over. He crouches beside Karin, lifts her hand. Jude gingerly d the silk tie across Karin's long fingernails. A blue thre catches under her index finger. He pulls tie away, releas her hand. Karin's fingers reflexively curl around the sky blue thread.

Jude enters tying tie. He presses his shoe against tile floor, then raises foot reveal faint bloody footprint. He steps again, leaving fa and fainter footfalls. Jude lifts receiver from wall phone, dials number from me He squats against wall, receiver pressed to his ear. He w fiddles impatiently. Paperback books are stacked everywhe Someone finally answers. Jude speaks with cadence of one  conditioned to command:

Hello? (pause) Hello. Homicide, please. (pause) They ought to be answering, unless  they're asleep. A girl has been  murdered. (pause) A girl was killed, I tell you! (pause) 2085 M Street. (pause) M Street, not N Street, you idiot! (pause) Who was she? Karin Schreiber. On the  fifth floor. (pause) You got all that? Read it back to  me.

Mazzo listens, nods, checks watch. Satisfied, he stands t hang up phone. It's time to go. He turns back to frig, opens door. Jude removes bottle of Moet champagne, tucks it under his arm. He walks away, le refrigerator door ajar.

Jude exits elevator, walks to main entrance. His eyes fli side to side. Otherwise, his face's a blank mask. The front door opens as Mazzo reaches for handle. He's  suddenly face to face with RIA MALED, 24, about to enter. They freeze. Have they met? Do they know each other? Ria's dressed chic/casual. Either Arab or Italian. Slight built with piercing eyes. Suspicious type -- like those  longtime students who never graduate.
Excuse me.
Huh?
Excuse me, please, I'd like to get  through.
Sorry.
Mazzo steps back as Ria passes. Jude exits, proceeds to  sidewalk. Ria pauses in lobby to watch him. No doubt: he  knows our Jude.

* MOVING POV from inside Jude's Beretta: Justice Dept. co looms immediately ahead. Washington D.C. Capitol Dome cro the six-story skyline. The Justice Department, built 1931-35, a monumental Art D structure halfway between the Capital and the White House It's granite facade is richly decorated with columns, fri and inscriptions. Military personnel patrol the sidewalks All visitors are screened. D.C. seems under siege. Pink p sign at entrance warns: "Caution, Power Doors Swing Out." The FBI Building, 1974, Hoover's monolith, engulfs the  neighboring block. Its brutal design dwarfs human scale a feeling. SCREENWRITER'S NOTE: Special consideration is given to  architecture throughout the script. The story is set in v brave new world. Post-modern structures, such as Washingt Harbour (under construction), U.S. News, Westin and Grand hotels, are favored. International Style buildings are al prefered: L'Enfant Plaza, AFL-CIO, FBI headquarters.  Architecture of film need not be beautiful, it need only new. Historic Washington is irrelevant. Jude Mazzo's a ne creation; he needs new space.

White collar workers crowd impressive corner office  overlooking Pennsylvania Avenue. No flies on this bunch:  they exude self-righteousness of underlings on the rise.  Today's idealists aching to be tomorrow's bureaucrats. A mounted Justice Dept. seal, flanked by U.S. flags, sets the tone. Grid of framed photos feature Mazzo posing with politicians past and present. Two objects stand out from government-issue decor: a bright Memphis chair and  Neoexpressionist map of D.C. Just the right hip. The office workers watch CNN. Generic NEWSCASTER speaks f by blue screen pic of smoking subway platform. Bloodied w lies in photo foreground.

...The government has taken great  pains to remain calm throughout the  crisis, convinced any appearance of  panic would only encourage terrorists.  The President conducted business as  usual as pressure for action continues  to mount in the wake of the Statue  of Liberty bombing...
* CNN cuts to file footage of bleeding, frightened touris streaming from smoke-filled entrance to Statue of Liberty Paramedics and police hustle them away under glare of TV  cameras.

...Rumors of the U.S. response are  the talk of Washington. This we now  know for certain: the Attorney General  will announce, perhaps as soon as  tomorrow, the formation of an ad-hoc  anti-terrorism agency, an elite inter- departmental unit headed by an anti- terrorism "czar." The name most  mentioned...
YOUNG JUSTICE EMPLOYEE improvs dramatic drum roll.
...is that of Jude Mazzo, the high  profile United States District  Attorney from the District of  Columbia. Steve Dunn has compiled a  background report on Attorney Mazzo.  Steve --

REPORTER DUNN narrates bio over clips from Mazzo's career They include: -- Jude as young lawyer on courthouse steps. -- Jude unveils chart of underworld crime activities. -- Jude sworn in. -- Jude, in leather jacket and jeans, tells of undercover drug buy. -- Jude receives VFW commendation. -- Jude at White House reception. -- Jude jumping from helicopter, followed by FBI. Clips cover five years. In early footage, Jude's dress an manner are bland. Later, he's the opposite: snazzy, confi charismatic.

...first burst on the scene with his  vigorous organized crime and drug  prosecutions, breaking all the  unwritten rules. The politicos all  stood their distance, waiting for  Mazzo to take his fall. Instead,  came a wave of convictions. Not  surprisingly, Mazzo turned his  attention to city corruption. Within  eight months, 16 state and local  officials had resigned...
Mazzo's cohorts joke, wisecrack to screen. Jude's very mu a hero here -- both loved and respected.
...Even those opposed to the new  agency seem to have no objections  concerning Attorney Mazzo. He is, in  the words of the President, "an  American hero."
Door opens. All eyes turn. Jude strides in, Moet bottle under his arm. Office staff  bursts into spontaneous applause. Mazzo pops cork, sendin spray across room. He speaks rapid-fire:

Get some glasses, they're in the  cupboard -- not too many. And turn  that thing off. Sandy? I'll never  understand how seemingly intelligent  people who spend their days planting  stories and manipulating coverage  can turn around, flip on the news,  sit there and watch it like God was  sending it down fresh from Mt. Sinai.  Manna! (looks) Great, over here.
YOUNG OFFICE WORKER distributes plastic glasses as SANDY, "Executive Assistant," turns off TV. Jude spills champagn as he pours from glass to glass.
Congratulations, sir.
Others echo congratulations. Jude pours:
Here, here. Thank you. (suddenly harsh) Stop!
They all freeze. Awkward silence.
This is no time for celebration. (pauses for effect) And you can quote me on that.
Jude breaks into laugh, takes swig. Impromptu party resum Staff divides into threes and fours. ALAN, 29, speaks with fellow EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT out of  earshot:
Who's Mazzo taking to the new agency?
Get in line: that's what everybody  wants to know. That's where the  action's gonna be. And Jude ain't  talking.
Jude, working crowd, approaches:
We're going to miss you.
It won't be the same.
I'll be around. You can't get rid of  me that easy. Besides, Milton will  step right in.
It won't be the same.
SECOND EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT joins them. Jude turns to him:
What's green with four legs and does  impressions?
(to 2nd Ass't) Don't answer.
I want it on my desk in the morning.  Clayton, right? (walks off)
That's how he gets his jokes.

Jude steps beside ASSISTANT U.S. ATTORNEY AVERY MILTON, J right-hand man and confidant. Ass't Attorney Milton, late fifties, seems more suited to office than courtroom. He's quite content to stand in Jude's shadow.
So, congratulations once again.
Thanks, Milt.
Mazzo, smiling, calls to unseen staff member:
You're coming with me, don't forget!
Milton suppresses sting of slight: he hasn't been asked.  Nearby, TWO ATTORNEYS dish breaking murder:
...it's this really hot babe. You  know, sweater meat for miles. Embassy  connections all over. The whole  package. Zapped.
The Thai girl -- ?
No way Homicide get this juiced over  a gook. They're 'Nam-heads --
Mazzo and Milton walk over. Second Attorney brightens, fa
You hear this, boss? Gorgeous girl,  diplomatic connections, then zi-ip -- (throat cut gesture) Page one all the way.
No other marks on body. Mint condition  from the neck down.
Where's this from?
Precinct gossip. Real sketchy. We're  gonna get called in -- to check out  the "political angle." Probably  banging Embassy Row like Mother  Theresa --
(correcting) -- Mata Hari --
(cuts in) Where?
N Street. Two thousand something.

(disgusted) What did your brain do while your  dick was going to law school? 2000 N  is a vacant lot! And don't be so  fast to jump to judgement. (calls to others) There's only one guilty person around  here!
All stop silent. Second Attorney shrivels in pinstripes, career hanging by a thread. Jude laughs:
And that's me!
Two Attorneys, relieved, join laughter. Mazzo resumes  conversation with First Attorney:
They want us there? The Justice  Department?
That's what I hear. Request en route.
(to Milton) Well, let's dig it out. Thank God, I  thought I was going to have to spend  my last day here drinking champagne --  I don't even like champagne. Com'on,  Milt, let's go.
They walk off. Second Attorney turns to First:
Tell me I'm wrong. Tell me I didn't  fuck my promotion. (slaps head) Damn!
* Beretta coupe exits wrought deco gates, heads west on 9 past FBI Building. Black-on-white Justice Dept. license p distinguish Jude's coupe from surrounding cars.

Jude/Milton MOVING POV inside car: 2085 M Street appears  amid flashing red and yellow lights. D.C. police cordon o reporters and onlookers. TWO PARAMEDICS rest against  ambulance, as if awaiting instructions. * PATROLMAN recognizes Jude as Beretta parks. He escorts  Mazzo and Milton through crowd as pushing newsmen call, " Judi." Mazzo acknowledges photo flashbulbs as he enters.

"Evidence Gathering Technicians" take notes, collect  fingerprints, label evidence. Policeman crosses from livi room to kitchen. No one seems in a hurry. Faint red light flashes below partially drawn window shade. Two plainclothes officials chat casually near bedroom doo DECT. GILBERT GIDEON, 48, FBI, speaks in tones befitting  seniority. LT. MICHAEL WEISS, 37, District of Columbia  Homicide Division, listens to Gideon, defers, smiles. Bot men, conservatively dressed, exude careerism: intense,  intelligent, well-exercised. Jude's arrival causes immediate stir. They've been waitin for him. Mazzo nods to others as he and Milton join Gideo and Weiss, exchange handshakes:
Thanks for coming yourself, Mr.  Attorney. I know you're busy. You  know Lt. Weiss, D.C. Homicide -- ?
(nods) What took you so long to call in the  request, Gideon? (to Weiss) Just look, Lieutenant, and hope you  never know the hell of a FBI man  asking for help --
(defensive) The Bureau can't afford mistakes. I  had to be certain of the foreign  policy ramifications. Then we found  this. Look.
Gideon takes bound leather address book from shelf, hands to Mazzo:
Her address book: diplomats, lefties,  lobbyists -- goddamn Who's Who. Just  look at the first name under "B."  Your name is even in there.
She cut out clippings of political  events, terrorist incidents, the New  York subway bomb --
That too?
Post.
Where is she?
In the bedroom.
Let's take a look.

Jude and others enter "boudoir" as Technicians collate  evidence. Jude, expressionless, scans room as if seeing i for the first time. Adjusts his tie. Bed furnishings, measured, labeled, remain as before. Kar body lies unmoved under pink sheets.
Karin Schreiber, 24, Dutch passport.
Jude pauses at portable tape player atop TV, depresses "p lever. Tape hiss followed by phone RING. Big Bopper answe from two-inch speakers: "Hel-lo, ba-by. Yeah, this is the Big Bopper Speakin.'"
Pull back the sheets.
Mazzo watches as EVIDENCE GATHERING TECHNICIAN #1 unveils Karin's body. Dry blood forms Rorschach stain beside her  neck. Jude tilts his head to study corpse: very sexy, ver Madame Tussard.
Clean razor wound. No trace of the  murder weapon.
Cover her up. Who's name was the  apartment in?
Mazzo steps into bathroom, turns shower nozzle on and off Gideon ejects "Chantilly Lace" as others observe from bed
Hers. The victim.
The neighbor?
A doctor... A man completely above  suspicion. The other apartment vacant --
And who gets everything? The husband?
Separated three years.
Mazzo examines tile floor; pink stain washes down drain.
Bring him in for questioning.
Weiss eyeballs Gideon: whose case is it? D.C.P.D. or FBI? Mazzo retraces steps through bedroom:
Who's conducting the investigation?
Homicide --
FBI.
D.C. Homicide will continue its  investigation.
Gideon shrugs. Local cops are Gumbies in FBI world view.  Mazzo continues into kitchen.
Her address book?
Jude opens refrigerator door:
Keep it. I want no coverup.
EVIDENCE GATHERING TECHNICIAN #2 approaches with stack of black-and-white glossies.
(eager) Look, the victim posed for these  crime scene photographs. Like some  cheap magazine. Obviously taken by  an amateur.

Technician displays 8x10 "crime scene" stills. In each Ka Schreiber is the "victim." Jude's eyes fix on photos. The feature: -- Karin, fully clothed, slumped against toilet bowl. -- Karin, in bra and panties, face-down on carpet, plasti fish in her mouth. -- Karin, wearing only mini-skirt, draped over bed. Her b covered with record albums and tapes. Laughing VOICES initiate flashback.

A year before. Jude and Karin at play, laughing as they s "crime scene" photos. Big Bopper sings on stereo. Mazzo, hair tussled, wields Nikon like work tool. Barefoo he wears white shirt, dark trousers. He's ten pounds heav Karin leans head against bureau.
Don't move!
Jude snaps picture. FLASH!
TIMECUT. "Seventy-six Trombones" plays as Karin poses ove toilet. She twists head, drops jaw, stares vacantly. Jude moves erratically, testing camera angles, speaking as if  spellbound:
...She was a SAS stewardess. Having  an affair with two different pilots --  both at 37,000 feet! We found her in  the ladies room at JFK, choked, just  like that. A real beauty. Hold it.
Mazzo snaps another pic -- FLASH! -- pulls Karin to feet:
Who do you want to do now?
The rock and roll singer! Julie!
Right.

* SCREENWRITER'S NOTE: The choice of pop source music (wi the exception of "Chantilly Lace") is indicative, not  proscriptive. Jude is the product of rock and roll, more  Presley than politics. Source music should also provide i counterpoint to action, reinforcing symbolic drama -- kee viewer at arm's length. Alternative titles, equally effec spring to mind: "Changes" by David Bowie, "Hanky Panky" b Tommy James and the Shondells, "Man Machine" by Kraftwerk "Imagine" by John Lennon, etc.
TIMECUT. Karin, mini-skirted, hangs half-naked over bed.  Joan Jett sings "I Love Rock and Roll." Jude narrates  scenario:
...she's found in a cheap motel  outside Crisfield. Her tongue ripped  out, body covered with record albums  and tapes -- all sacred music...
Mazzo yanks albums from shelves, places them on Karin as hums mantra "om."
...her boyfriend was a religious  fanatic, divinity school dropout --
(objects) No, he was an artist --
-- we found him two blocks away in a  local bar, listening to her beautiful  voice coming from the jukebox like  an angel's.
He snaps again. FLASH! Karin returns to life:
The revolutionary!

TIMECUT. Jude places Karin, wearing grey skirt and black  bra, on chaise as Village People repeat, "I'm a macho, ma man..." Mazzo bounds about, ecstatic. Karin howls with  laughter. They grow frenetic with each enactment. Their psyches mel for a moment: is it sex or is it symbiosis? Jude circles:
A young coed. University of Maryland.  Murdered by her sociology professor,  suffocated by $100 bills. Then raped  after she was dead...
Mazzo stuffs Kleenex in Karin's mouth, spreads her knees:
...Spread your legs. Now don't move.
Click. FLASH! Karin removes tissues from mouth:
But don't you get excited when they're  found like this?
I was very excited by a case several  years ago. (kneels beside her) He had a device... (voice trails off)
Tell me about it.
(embarrassed) No, no, I can't.
Technician #2'S VOICE returns us to present:
Obviously the work of an amateur.
U.S. Attorney Mazzo turns from "crime scene" photos, walk over bloody footprints (now covered with plastic). Gideon joins him from bedroom:
He must have been an idiot.
Who?
The killer.
Why is he an idiot?

Because of the way he acted. Stupidly  and arrogantly. He empties her jewelry  box but dosen't take the money. He  kills her, then marches into the  john to shower. Puts shoes on, leaves  footprints across kitchen. Just  stupid.
According to you.

Mazzo and Gideon stare eye to eye; their rivalry rises to surface. Gideon bites lip, represses resentment. "Just wa Gideon's eyeballs say, "I too will have my day." Jude puts his arm around Detective Gideon:
You know I have put together a task  force for NATA, the new antiterror  agency, Gid, and I was thinking I  might have something that would  interest you.
Gideon's honored but wary. He quickly calculates pros and cons:
God knows I'm flattered. Honest,  Jude. I'm just not sure I could work  for you --
Name a position.
(shakes head) I'm willing to be swallowed but not  digested. I don't want to end up in  the rectum.
I respect that. I can respect dumb.
Mazzo walks back toward bedroom.
Jude watches as Paramedics lower Karin's body onto stretc looks to Milton and Weiss:
I really wish it were the husband,  too. It would be easier.
Hawaiian silkscreens now top lit, hang on wall. Mazzo and Milton cross as cops screen incoming residents. Ahead, TV lights glare blindingly through front doors.

Reporters yell questions as Jude/Milton squeeze through p gauntlet without comment. Mazzo turns to favor "Eyewitnes News" crew, recognizes dim profile in crowd: Ria Maled. J quickly continues; Milt follows. Mazzo subtly motions to SAM ZEGNER, 23, peach-fuzzed "pri journalist," as he and Avery approach Beretta. Jude point to pay phone, dials in pantomine. Sam responds with nod a Mazzo and Milton enter car, drive away. Sam scurries to phone booth, inserts coin, punches dial  buttons: the Jimmy Olson illusion vanishes -- just anothe headline whore.
Carphone RINGS. Jude picks up receiver as they drive sout through Georgetown. Sam speaks from M Street phone booth, sometimes OFF SCREEN, sometimes ON SCREEN:
Rumor says we got a scandal. Great  going away present, huh, Attorney?  Or should I call you Director?  Congratulations by the way. So? So?
It's still "Mr. Attorney" and no  comment, Sam.
Jude, please. I've got a lot of dirty  minds to feed.
Just this -- but it didn't come from  me...
Of course not -- I'm not even on the  phone.
The place reeked of sex. You can't  imagine. Unnatural acts. Really  disgusting -- and one other thing.  We didn't find any underwear in the  apartment. None. Not anywhere.
Sex crime?
No, she just didn't wear any. Your  readers oughtta like that.
Great, I'll lead with it. Any names  involved? Diplomatic corps, I bet.  Right? Why else would you be there?  Must be big --

False alarm, nothing there. The Bureau  and D.C.P.D. will investigate -- if  they can stop pissin on each other. (a beat) Go for the crime-of-passion, Sam.  Lead with the domestic angle, follow  with the kink. Play up the husband.  He's the key. Trust me. Do this for  me, okay?
Great, thanks. (Jude hangs up)
Mazzo doesn't bother with goodbyes. Conversation terminat Never transpired. Georgetown U. shops and bars pass right and left. Milton  hasn't spoken for some time. Jude turns to him:
I want you to keep me informed on  this Schreiber case, Milt. Keep on  it.
From the Justice Department? I don't  even know what my job will be after  you leave. I may not have access. I  may not have a desk.
What do you mean, Justice Department? (a beat) Didn't I tell you?
(confused) What?
Do you think I'd let someone as good  as you slip through my hands? You're  coming with me to NATA -- as first  or second assistant, unless something  else, of course. I told you weeks  ago.
Avery's palpably relieved. His fear of being left behind become an obsession. He would have, of course, remembered earlier offer -- that's for sure! -- no matter now.
I remember now...
Maybe I wasn't clear.
I appreciate the faith you have in  me. I won't let you down.

Later that night. Beretta drives under Whitehurst Freeway turns in sprawling commercial/residential complex -- the  "Washington Harbour" development, completion date 1987,  Postmodern equivalent of Watergate Office Building: just ugly, twice as trendy. On the Potomac, south of Georgetow Washington Harbour boasts Cuisinart mix of arches, ariels bays and balconies -- a yuppie Watts Towers. Jude parks in assigned space, enters door flanked by  ornamental columns. Lawn lights exaggerate structure's fa tale architecture.
He passes mirror of trompe l'oeil wallpaper, waits for  elevator, steps in as doors close.
Jude rounds corner, approaches through corridor of "Etrus murals. Each floor has distinct decor -- each a tier of  tackiness. Mazzo withdraws keys, unlocks apartment door.

Jude strides across rectangle room overlooking Potomac.  Arlington County glistens out the window. Furniture and f objects sit at odd angles; behind, a Shaker pew is stacke with file cartons. "Superman" pinball machine stands behi Brian Ferry croons "The Stroll" from vintage Rockola juke Jude's footsteps echo Ferry's beat. He loosens his tie.

Jude closes door, sits at custom-made desk -- crescent sl of green marble atop Mission Style base. Faded "Washingto Senators" pennant hangs between celebrity photos. Bookshe blanket the adjoining walls. CNN plays silently on deskto TV. Jude removes Karin's purloined necklace, unwraps it. Afte brief glimpse, he rewraps necklace in handkerchief, locks in desk drawer. Mazzo stares at black phone. It RINGS OFF SCREEN.
Mazzo rolls around sheets, unable to sleep. OFF SCREEN  telephone RINGS. Karin speaks in flashback:
Mr. Attorney? You don't know me. How  could you? We never met. Think I go  around with cops?...
Eighteen months before. Karin, wearing brown negligee, si on bed, speaks on phone. Poising finger over disconnect  button, she laughs into receiver. Dialogue continuous fro previous scene:

(Taunting) ...Who am I? Maybe I'm a terrorist.  One of the two thousand terrorists  running free you talk so much about.  Bet you think you're sexy in those  discount suits that bulge up the  crotch? (a beat) What's my name? (laughs) Why don't you find out? You're so  smart. Always giving interviews,  being photographed -- speaking of  which, you should lose some weight. (hangs up)
